heading: The Rise of Static Site Generators
author: Emily White
content:
Static Site Generators (SSGs) like Jekyll, Hugo, and Next.js offer a modern approach to building websites. They pre-build pages into a set of static HTML, CSS, and JavaScript files at build time.

This results in websites that are incredibly fast, secure, and cheap to host, as they can be served directly from a Content Delivery Network (CDN) without needing a traditional backend server.
